text: anyone know why the form embed doesn’t seem to make the redirect_url available? I’ve tried js and hubl for creating the form
I tried a few things like recreating module, cloning module
I can't remember what else I did

it just seems so weird. the value must be there somewhere, unless its somehow queried by the redirect_id onformsubmit or something. im more interested in learning how this works for myself, im sure i can figure out some other solution for the client hah

I think for a temp fix which I scratched was using a if statement on the message. If it contained https then I would redirect it.  I think that was the best workaround I had... I eventually scrapped it, because it was for a client and it would have been too complicated for them to use properly.
So I was just pasting in the redirect url as the inline message
If it was my own site, I would still have that working just didn't make sense to have the hack in the clients hands
ahh so have them paste the redirect url into the inline ty message field?
yup, that is what I remember doing, and then having to do some hubl if checks and manually redirect it in JS

Hopefully this is the right place for this question. I have some dev background but haven't done much lately, and it seems like I should be able to fire some javascript to get this done...

I want the chatflow module to expand and launch a particular chatflow on the page when a CTA is clicked. I don't want the CTA to navigate anywhere (though, if necessary, I can pick a page).

Is this at all possible?

Longer version: I want a primary CTA in our website header to "Request Demo". I want the chatbot to fire up when that's clicked, so that I can navigate through some qualifying questions before sending them through to a sales rep.

Thanks in advance!
